There were visible water damage stains on the ceiling, and peeling paint all over. I expect this from motel-6, but a presidential suite ($$$) should be the best of everything throughout, not some cheap rundown old nasty hotel experience! I will never stay here again, and neither should you. The pool was nasty, unclean, with foam (pollution) in abundance -- if youre a nonsmoker, this is a nonsmoking facility, but you wouldn't know it, since everyone smokes 2 feet from the entry and exits, even in the pool! No one from the staff seems to take notice or enforce a nonsmoking policy. Horrible facility!

Reviews.Title: “Glad we took the chance!”
Reviews.Author: triping_family
Reviews.Content: I was worried about staying at this hotel after seeing bad reviews but I’m glad we did. * Staff = very friendly & helpful. If we needed something all we had to do was ask. * Cleanliness = very clean. Housekeeping even folded our fresh towels into designs. * Parking = on a slope. You are in the Ozarks & most parking is on a slope in Branson. * WIFI = Many different signals with speed around 500K * Pool = similar size as many other Branson hotels because I could see pools & swimmers from the main road. We used the pool multiple times a day and I saw employees cleaning and stocking fresh towels every time we went in the evening. Bonus: Since the pool is not near the road & elevated above parking level we were not watched by people stuck in traffic or sitting in their cars while we swam. I would recommend this hotel to a friend and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Customer Service Hotel in Branson”
Reviews.Author: DebbieV378
Reviews.Content: We recently brought the National Autumn Leaf Collectors Club (NALCC) national convention to the Radisson Hotel in Branson, MO. The entire hotel staff, from the sales group to the food services group, were there for our needs. They had this Host's back 100%. I highly recommend the Radisson for any function you might want to bring to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend to family and friends”
Reviews.Author: alissa8871
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a family 4th of July getaway to Branson. There are so many cheap, cheesy, gross looking hotels off of 76...everyday we were more and more grateful to be staying at the Radisson. Service was professional and friendly, rooms were clean and comfortable, location was perfect and our vacation was amazing! When returning to Branson we will definitely choose the Radisson again and will recommend to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “STAY A WAY IT'S TERRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: dont_worry_be_happy1
Reviews.Content: Wow this was bad !!! The pool was closed all day with no warning !!!! If it was open it is very small and over flowing the one dy it was open!!The beds don't work!! They are Sleep number but AGINE they don't work very uncomfortable !!! The bathrooms are very small!!! The staff is rude !! their is a $10.oo a night charge for a small fridge!! The parking is a night mare !!! the food in the hotel is very high priced and not good after you eat it!!! This is the type of place you would recommend to your mother in law!!! Also water is cold and NO EXTRA PILLOWS!!! they is more bad things but this is all I care to sare

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the bad reviews.”
Reviews.Author: Jpman7
Reviews.Content: We are here based on a time share program, so I didn't pick the Radisson. I checked here to see what to expect. Based on the number of bad reviews, i didn't have high hopes. To my surprise I have found everything up to par. The staff has been friendly and helpful. The room is very clean. The pool, while on the small side, is clean and inviting. I think it is well worth the rate they charge.

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Flychickdfw
Reviews.Content: My daughters and I stayed at this hotel the last week of June, 2011. It's a family friendly with the kids under 10 eat free (didn't try the restaurant), fun pool with the indoor/outdoor swim underneath the windows feature. They loved the hot tub! (I didn't swim, I thought the swimming area had a lot to be desired, the floors were dirty and the pool not so clean either.) The hotel is in a great location, walking distance to go karts, mini golf, bumper boats, restaurants such as Jimmy Johns and Papa John. We had a clean room on the 3rd floor. The staff of the hotel was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: wenhar17
Reviews.Content: The room and bathroom where very small, not functional for a family of four that included two small kids. The indoor/outdoor pool was equally as small and though it is heated you could not tell. There is also no complementary breakfast. You spend enough to stay in the hotel the least they could do is provide breakfast. The customer service was not good either, the man that was at the front desk could have cared less to wait on us or answer any questions that we had.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again!!”
Reviews.Author: Willadean70
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was excellent, from the from desk to the bell staff. Housekeeping was very helpful. There is plenty of handicap parking, but for those who use regular parking, parking is on a hill. The rooms were clean, but the bathrooms are small. The lobby area is clean and inviting. We had special needs and they were accounted for and staff was very, very helpful. I've stayed in many, many hotels but this is one of the most helpful that I have been too. If you have someone who is unable to be out of the room all of the time, I would suggest a higher floor with a view, looking towards the strip, as this helps to pass their time. We were at first on a lower level and asked for a change because of this reason. Hotel staff was very helpful in helping us change our room. I know for everyone this is not a priority. But for seniors with medical problems this is sometimes a priority.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joedoesntlikeyou
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for three nights on a getaway trip for my birthday. I have to say I would have never chosen this hotel but it was an unpublished rate on Expedia. Quick side note on that, it saved us a whopping $5 a night versus the published rate and we had two separate beds in our room, pick your own hotel. Pulling up to the hotel was impressive. It is huge. The outside looked fine and the location of it was great. The first thing we noticed though was the extreme incline of the parking lot. It's the type of parking that requires an emergency brake at all times. The lobby was well maintained and check in was hassle free. The elevator floor had cracked tile and was see through facing outside. While it was impressive at first even the outside view was a let down because every window on the way up seemed to get more dirty. One window you almost couldn't see out of. When we arrived on our floor we immediately noticed that they run no air conditioning in the halls. It was uncomfortably hot. It was 90+ degrees outside our whole stay so this never got better. Upon entering our room one of the two beds we had was half broken down and never finished. We put away our things and let the hotel know, they handled this problem while we were out and they were extremely nice about it. I am the type of person who wants to enjoy their room, not just sleep in it. Therefore it seems like I notice a lot of small details. The hotel is in desperate need of an upgrade. The floors in the bathroom are black and white checkered tile. The bottom of the tub was stained with dirt that wouldn't come up. The door to our bathroom was coming apart at the bottom. The one bed that was put together when we arrived had the bed sheet on inside out. The temperature in the room is controlled by a thermostat but doesn't have an only air or only heat option so when the room would get too cold we would adjust it up and the heat would kick on. That meant we had to constantly play with the thermostat to make sure we kept the perfect temperature. The final problem I had wasn't as big for me as it is for most people, maybe because I have worked in restaurants all my life. I found two bugs in my bed the morning we were leaving. I was breaking the beds down for the housekeepers and found one bug which I couldn't tell exactly what it was and another very small spider. I must say I never said anything to management because I'm not the type of person who wants things for free. I dealt with it and went on. A quick list of the positives of this hotel: It has an on site bar and the service was amazing. Their staff couldn't have been better. Our bellman on the way out was very helpful and every time I called the front desk I always got the help I needed. In closing, if you are the type of person who just needs somewhere to sleep while you are in Branson this hotel is not the worst choice. There are much more affordable ones though that probably fit your needs. If you are the type of person who enjoys coming back to a relaxing room that is designed well and updated, maybe even clean and bug free, you should not even think about booking this. If you found this review helpful please mark it as helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: babyboomer007
Reviews.Content: My mother, sister and 16 year old daughter stayed here on Wed. June 8, 2011. My husband made the reservations for me and was able to get a good price. We were running out of time getting to a 3:30 show followed by a 7:30 show, but was able to check in quickly and get a room assignment along with several keys before going to the shows. We were able to get a room on the first floor and were pleased to walk into a clean, cool room along with the rollaway bed I had requested. Thank you Randy at the front desk for such great service! My daughter was able to swim for about an hour before the pool closed for adults only. My sister and I enjoyed relaxing in the hot tub for a few minutes before going to sleep. Closing the pool and hot tub for adults only from midnight to 2 a.m. I consider one of the best features. My daughter was also able to get up the next morning and run on the treadmill before we left for the day. Overall this hotel was great for our situation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: dereckmandy
Reviews.Content: We were weary of staying here at first because of the reviews. So we arrived expecting the worst but we are very happy that we got this hotel. The hotel is located in the best location I think you could get in Branson right in the middle of everything. The rooms are very nice we did not get the sleep number bed wich did not bother us because we have slept on them before and did not like it but the mattress was very comfortable. The bathroom was small as we had read in the reviews but you are in a hotel not a condo. We will not stay anywhere else when we come back to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean, Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: jmbbjb
Reviews.Content: We were there for a yellow ribbon military event. The room was very clean. The sleep number beds would have been great if they had dual controls. There is not a continental breakfast provided. You can purchase breakfast at the restaurant, but with children it is nice to have breakfast provided. We had meetings in the morning and the meeting rooms were fine. The kids loved the pool and it stays open late which is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room”
Reviews.Author: rhitky34
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and in a great location. The beds were great. The bathroom was small, but that didn't bother us. I loved the bedding, it was comparable to the Gaylord we stayed at in Dallas. I also liked the noble romans in the lobby, the breadsticks were a great late night snack...

Reviews.Title: “Glad I could try a sleep number bed before buying one”
Reviews.Author: dzur626
Reviews.Content: Was nice I was able to check in about an hour before advertised time. Check in was very smooth as this was a package deal. Front desk associate asked how high up we'd like to stay which was nice since my husband is afraid of heights. Room was clean, nothing out of the ordinary. Was a little disappointed when I realized the beds were double beds and not queen. The website does say that but I was thinking double as in two beds, not double as in size. Very disappointing to us as my husband is a pretty big man. I ended up sleeping at the foot of the bed with my kids since there wasn't enough room for the two of us and it was like being on a waterbed with the sleep number bed. Wouldn't stay again due to bed size.

Reviews.Title: “Dump. Filthy dump. Don't believe ratings here or on Priceline”
Reviews.Author: JNB412
Reviews.Content: Flithy is the key word here. Pool was a hairball mess. Huge chunk of skin found on bathroom sink sent the wife over the edge. Please, I beg you not to stay here. We were stuck after believing Pricelines 3 star rating. It was wrong and so is the one on Trip Advisor. Many complaints about the pool went unanswered, the peanut shells on the deck remained our entire stay. Everything about this place was negative. The room was not vacuumed when we got there and my wife called down every day to ask that it be done, it wasn't.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: krazypaige
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as part of a package deal. Yes, the bathroom was pretty small, but it was clean and the shower had nice hot water, couldn't ask for much else. We didn't try any of the onsite restaurants as we decided to spend our one evening in Branson somewhere else. Overall, I would stay there again if we are in the Branson area again.

Reviews.Title: “Name your own price on priceline.com”
Reviews.Author: joewathen
Reviews.Content: 55.00+tax per night Great location...right in the middle of town. Stayed on the 6th floor. Room was nice and clean. Front desk allowed early check in and Kathy is the most friendly person you will ever meet! Pool area is open til 2am!! BIG PLUS! Restaurant menus said open til 11pm but were closed before 10pm. not happy :( - i wanted a pizza! Wi-Fi was free but speed was slow. Only getting 1meg from my room. LOTS of people in and out during the day. This is a huge hotel for Branson...but hallways and rooms were very quiet. Stayed a thursday and friday night.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise, better than expected. Nice, clean rooms, has small indoor pool area”
Reviews.Author: whirligig
Reviews.Content: After reading recent mixed reviews of this Radisson our group made reservations because of the central location, availability of rooms, and price and then hoped for the best -- found the rooms were clean, carpets passed the "white socks" test, bathroom very small but clean. Plenty of thick, big clean towels - even a specially folded towel in the shape of a swan on the bed! Sleep Number beds okay, comfortable but not going to rave about them. Coffee in the room but only a small one cup coffee maker. No continental complimentary breakfast but room service menu adequate, prices comparatively reasonable. Elevators worked promptly, no waiting and the hotel was busy. Did not seem to have many handicapped parking spaces. Parking is on a hillside and you may have to park uphill with a steep walk down to or back uphill from the main entrance but there are parking options on other sides of the hotel that offer a less hilly spot, maybe farther from main entrance but lighting is adequate. Great location, close to the main Hwy 76 where so many of the shops and shows are located (and the heavy traffic) but also this hotel is convenient to the yellow route traffic bypass . Hotel staff were friendly and helpful, no problems with check-in. Corner room had windows with a great view, curtains were layered -- a room darkening heavy liner plus a layer of sheers with another drapery. Walls are thin, you definitely might hear your neighbors. TV worked perfectly, many cable channels. There are restaurants close by, within walking distance of this hotel. The indoor pool area is VERY SMALL and that is a problem if your group wants to swim. The hot tub also small, too many people using it - water didn't look clean. The pool is divided between a heated outdoor section (warm water but chilly, cold November mountain air!) and a smaller section inside a steamy heated pool room with the hot tub and sauna. Pool area does not look like the website photo. If your group chooses this hotel based on wanting an indoor pool in cold weather, maybe think twice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: kitcatSt_Louis
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in November. It was very clean, had a nice bar, didn't try the restaurant though. Pool area was good. Nice comfortable beds, although the pillows could be fluffier. Bathroom was a little small, but very clean. The staff were what really made this place, they were so friendly and made you feel welcome. It is in a very good location. Behind the Moon River. We walked to the Andy Williams Christmas show from there. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, just about ready for a refresh.”
Reviews.Author: herbster8395
Reviews.Content: Sleep number bed is great - bathrooms are showing their age with wear and small size. Could you use a remodel to bring it out of the 90's.

Reviews.Title: “It was good enough...”
Reviews.Author: jantharre
Reviews.Content: When you get into the hotel for the first time, the lobby and hallways take you back to the 90's as far as decor and feel. The room was updated and very clean. There was no closet, and the bathroom was very small. We had a king size bed and it was a sleep number, so that was very nice. The hotel worked nicely for us because it is in the center of everything and you can take the back roads to access it and, we only used the hotel for sleeping. I would not recommend this hotel if you are just looking for some relaxation. The walls are somewhat thin, the rooms aren't very big, and the hallways are very small. About the closet, all you get is a little furniture piece with doors on it for your closet. The TV's are old and they put out an annoying high frequency sound. I guess we're just used to LCD's now. One thing I really enjoyed was the free WiFi. My wife and I both used it a lot and they're were plenty of signals all around the hotel! Overall, it provided everything that we needed and we were comfortable. I would definitely recommend this hotel to my family and friends. Also, if you can, request one of the corner rooms of the hotel, they are much larger!

Reviews.Title: “It was just OK.”
Reviews.Author: ColetteO
Reviews.Content: The staff was fairly friendly and the room was clean. And really...those are the things that count the most. The lobby and corridors were not as clean nor as nice as the actual rooms. Low ceilings and dated decor took the overall rating down a bit. The fitness center was disappointing. Very small and equipment was not well maintained. We did enjoy the sauna.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Quiet Easy to Find Close to theatres and restaurants”
Reviews.Author: moonstone0005
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The hotel lobby, hallways, and rooms were clean and in good state of maintenance. The sleep number beds were very comfortable. We requested a non smoking room and there was no smell of smoke in the room. Location is close to Highway 76, the main thoroughfare of Branson, and easy to find. There is a back road out of the parking lot, if you are in a hurry and want to avoid the heavy traffic on Highway 76. It is within walking distance of some shows, including the Andy Williams Theatre. The parking lot is well maintained, but most of it is on a hillside. Motorcycle and handicap parking are close to the lobby entrance, and flat or level. We did not eat in the hotel restaurant, but there are restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: 29bishop
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in good location and just off the Yellow Route so getting around Branson was easy. Room was good size, sleep number bed was very comfortable, shower was great [had plenty of pressure], but bathroom was really tiny [open door just cleared toilet]. Parking was plentiful but on steep hills. Big downside was being charged to use internet in lobby. Only time on trip we ran into this. Didn't spend a lot of time in room so overall it was a good choice for us.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best; in need of a remodel”
Reviews.Author: RyanKansas
Reviews.Content: We booked on Priceline and got a great deal. The location is good, right on the "strip" and there is plenty of parking; although, you may have to park at a 45 degree angle. The restaurant in the lobby is not good. The pool is small, dirty, and cold. It was empty though, which was nice. The rooms are small and just not fresh. The place needs new carpet and the beds were weirdly uncomfortable. If you can get a room dirt cheap, then it may be worth giving the place a try.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: debi93
Reviews.Content: Booked this Hotel for 3 nights, assumed since it was a Radisson that it would be nice. Parking is horrible, bathroom was the tiniest room I have seen ever in a hotel, tub was stained and dirty looking. HBO was so fuzzy you could not watch it. We sleep in a sleep number bed at home and were looking forward to having the same bed here, but wrong again. The sleep number control was broken and we spent three back breaking nights in this bed. We spend one or two weekends a year in Branson, have stayed in many different hotels and this hotel compared to a room that you can get for under $40 on the strip. Would never recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “So-So”
Reviews.Author: sbrew
Reviews.Content: Was OK. Great location. Rooms clean, updated. The bed and pillows were great!! Bathroom tub floor could use some painting. They charge to use the computer. Won't stay there again because of that.

Reviews.Title: “Not much hotel for the money.”
Reviews.Author: NWABeachFamily
Reviews.Content: Booked two connecting rooms. Hotel was very plain and ordinary which surprised me due to the size of the hotel right on the strip in Branson. The front desk area was a little dirty and very limited staff. The hotel has two restaurants and a bar. The main restaurant had a horrible smell when we walked into it, noticed no customers inside during dinner time, so we went to the Pizza place in the hotel, Nobel Romans. Looked at the Pizza and passed. Stepped into the bar for a drink and it had 4 people in the bar and it was completely filled with smoke -- so bad you couldn't breathe. With so many choices in Branson these days, I'd pass on this one and find something a little more special.

Reviews.Title: “parking was worst...”
Reviews.Author: coffee_lover_forever
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights. The room looked clean and nice. the bathroom was so TINY! you cant fit more than 1 person in there, and that made us late for our appointment the next day. the sleep number beds were HORRIBLE. it did not work, we called front desk and they said, they will send someone to check the next morning. the next night, same problem. it was hard as a rock, we couldnt sleep properly. the pool was okay, but jammed with people and the hot tub was yellow, and yucky looking. so, we decided to go use the sauna, but there were incests crawling everywhere. the excersice room was okay, but for a hotel that big it was very small. and to top everything, the parking was WORST! it was up and down the hill, and not lit properly.

Reviews.Title: “Do not assume this will be a good hotel because it's a Radisson.”
Reviews.Author: theyattering
Reviews.Content: This Radisson does not deserve the 3 star rating it received on Priceline. Normally the Radisson name is an indicator of quality, this specific hotel does not reflect that quality. The parking is horrible - very far from hotel entrances, the pool - far too small for the size of the hotel and amount of people booked to stay, the staff - friendly but totally unaccommodating and ignorant of surrounding restaurants (including those within the hotel). My husband and I were placed in a room with 2 double beds for a three night stay. Called down to switch rooms and was told there were no king rooms available as we were going to be there for 3 nights. Was not even offered to upgrade to a suite. Strange, as I would pay the difference and they would make more on our stay. The bathroom vents were filthy and the tile in the bathroom was broken. I realize how this review sounds, but it's true and I was totally dissatisfied with our stay. Also, as we purchased through Priceline, so there was no avenue of recourse as there is a "no refund" policy, so we could not even leave and go to a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Spent two nights at this hotel, and...”
Reviews.Author: MommiesRock_KC
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at this hotel, and overall enjoyed the stay UNTIL this morning we were sitting on the bed and a roach crawled out from under the sheets!!!! We were stunned. Overall the hotel seemed nice and clean for our stay, but the roach ruined my opinion of the hotel! We were pretty grossed out.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY AT THE RADISON”
Reviews.Author: grambino
Reviews.Content: This was a terrible experience. The staff was rude, the halls and elevators are not air conditioned. Don't bother taking children to the pool because they have it located next to the sports bar. All you smell is smoke and hear foul language. The rear entrance also leads you through the drunks and smoke. The restaurant is horrible and over priced. We will never go back there. The Welk Resort is twice the value and they're friendly. Actually we've enjoyed most of your hotels there, but not this one in the least. They have sleep number beds, but our didn't work the first night and we called for help and it never came. Called and called again and they promised and we finally gave up around 2:00 am because my wife had a conference in the morning. So our children slept on the floor and we slept on a bed hard as a rock. The high speed internet is certainly low speed. It was rarely functional for anything other than checking some news. The TV sets are old and ours had a blue line and focus went in and out. The building looks nice from the outside, but it all stops there!

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the bad reviews.”
Reviews.Author: highwayroamer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice. I stayed at the Fairfield Inn last night and it was fine......but the raddison makes you feel rich. It is also $15 cheaper per night.. Don't go by the travelocity prices, call them direct for the best rate. This however is a very large hotel, so a long walk from elevator to room is possible/.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great food, great service, great fun!”
Reviews.Author: mdh1964
Reviews.Content: We are frequent customers of this hotel. The rooms are clean and comfortable as well as very inviting.The food is great not only in the Bistro, but also in the bar and the snack area where pizzas are served. The staff is very professional and helpful- especially in the restaurant/banquet area. My family has also been very impressed with the bellman and how well we have been greeted upon arrival at this hotel. We will definitely be staying here again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the hotel website”
Reviews.Author: xyzzz3
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights during July 4, 2010 weekend. Had a suite on the 9th (top) floor, supposedly the best accommodations. Very disappointed. First room given (903) was full of bugs. The second room was better than that. The hotel website is VERY deceptive. Here are the facts about the hotel: old hotel, room/bathroom cleanliness is pathetic, sofas are stained to the point of being unhygienic, full breakfast buffet is third-grade, pool is very small, the restaurant (Wildwood Bistro) is very dirty, sofa bed was broken. Finally, the Jacuzzi tub was so stained and dirty that we feared infection and never got in. Complained to the front desk. The rep seemed understanding and dropped the nightly rate to $100 (from $179) even before asking. However, given the state of the hotel it is hardly worth $29.99 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't measure up to the Radisson quality.”
Reviews.Author: emilybelle
Reviews.Content: Pros: Our bellman was kind, polite, and had helpful information about the city. The housekeeper did a nice job keeping the room clean during our stay. Cons: The hotel is not in keeping with the quality we've experienced with the Radisson. On check-in, the attendant did not once make eye contact with me, it was like a cattle call, herding guests thru the process. The room was very small, the layout was difficult to get around with anyone else in the room. If you wanted to move, you would need to crawl over the bed to get around. The bathroom was also very small. The feel of the over all hotel was very dated, in terms of decor, and overall maintanance. The housekeeping staff did a nice job with what was available, but the place really needs some deep cleaning, and freshening up. The pool was just gross. First, continuing along the "small" theme, this is a huge hotel, with a little bitty pool. Imagine the rooms filled, with those guests wanting to use the pool. It was stuffy, unkempt, and just overall yuck. The smoking area was right next to it, so the smoke, just carried over into the pool area. This was one of the more disappointing features because we came for a mini vacation with our family, and were just too grossed out by the pool area to swim. This is really the quality of a 2 star hotel, just be prepared for that. We had a very reasonable rate, and still would not return.

Reviews.Title: “This is NOT a resort and asthma suffers should STAY ELSEWHERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: PangaRoxxa
Reviews.Content: 61 dollars a night on a midweek Priceline bid. Cons: No free breakfast, no guest laundry. No microwave, fridge costs extra and is no in good repair. Property is in a good spot for the strip, but right next to a deserted theater scheduled for demo. Watch your traffic patterns. Parking is a challenge, lots of hills, few front spaces. Back lot has 15 steep stairs to lower level. We were greeted on the second floor by the jackhammering of an ice machine. Walked in, and my one year old found a used toothpick on the bedside table. Bathrooms have NO ventilation fan. Two showers in, our toilet tank was dripping condensation. Constant sound of water running in the wall behind the toilet. Bathroom has NO locks, toilet paper holder juts out at toddler , eye level so be warned before you remove the roll (remember the no locks thing? There are no extra comforters available, only 3 portable cribs on the property.Threadbare does not begin to describe the blankets, they are pilled beyond belief and the ones for the portacrib are cut down adult sized ones-even worse! Pool area garbage cans were overflowing with liquor bottles and cases the entire stay. Housekeeping could be better. When we moved from a 2 queen to 1 king, the sound of the ac unit doubled. Pros: Restaurant and bar on site. Easy access to Blue Route. Staff (especially Liz) was very accommodating within the limitations of the property. Sleep Number bed was in good working order. Fifth floor is definitely better than second floor. Showers are mounted high. Decor is spare, but fairly recent and generally in good repair.

Reviews.Title: “We won't stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Vacationer201006
Reviews.Content: We had several problems during our stay. First the bathrooms, rooms and swimming pool were very small. When we were in the pool area, several other guests also made that comment for the size of the hotel the pool was too small. Service and elevators were very slow...try getting three drinks at the pool side and it took 45 minutes. Sinks in the bathrooms were clogged. Linens were dirty. Restuarants were closed due to their computers being down due to a storm and there wasn't any rain in the area. We had to leave go down the road to another restuarant. Breakfast was good but expensive. Concierge got us tickets to a show but we didn't realize they added fee to our order. Our infant son was in his walker in our room and we had to clean his feet because they were dirty from the floor. Parking lot was full at night and we had to park in the back which is fine except when you have a stroller and we didn't anything but stairs to go up to get into the hotel. That is a little tricky when you have diaper bags, baby and stroller to get up about 15 stairs. After taking these problems to management a few times they initally comp'ed our rooms. That we great that they did that but I would have rathered of stayed at a hotel with no problems and void the frustration. One good thing is our beds were comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: AzMarble
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights while traveling through Missouri. The rooms were very comfortable and the service was excellent. We highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: familytravelor123
Reviews.Content: Upon coming into my room, i went to the bathroom there was hair in the shower and sink and on the toliet. Toliet was dirty and the bed area was dirty also, if you have to pay $100 a night i think this hotel is way below a 3 star hotel and should not be rated a 5 star at all. The parking is horrible at this hotel, had to park a quarter mile away with kids was not fun. This hotel is dirty and needs to be cleaned real good. Pool area is very small for a hotel of this size. If you plan on staying here bring some lysol and clorox wipes. They only thing we liked was the sleep number beds they where comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay and will so stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: momoftwoboysjandw
Reviews.Content: Traveled with my husband and boys to Branson in June '10. The hotel was located on the 76 HYW, very close to everything the kids wanted to do. We had a beautiful suit on the 9th floor. The rooms were very comfortable with sleep number beds, huge whirlpool tub, shower and seperate living space. The pool area was wonderful with a hot tub and indoor/outdoor pool. We will definately stay again and would recommend the Raddison to all our friends and family. This was a smart stay for us!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic amenities, best staff around, right in the middle of the Branson strip!”
Reviews.Author: jfjdevos
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Radisson. Our room was one of the nicest I'd ever stayed in. Every little detail was taken care of by the staff. We could have eaten at dozens of other places, but found it so easy and economical to frequent the hotel's dining facilities. The food was fabulous and the atmosphere wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Facility to stay in and a great area to see.”
Reviews.Author: Joesilverado
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very spacious and the beds are very comfortable and the atmosphere in the area is just amazing. The Hotel staff is very helpful and friendly and the facility is well keep. The Bar and Restaurant serves a great varity of very delicious food and and snacks and the staff there too is the best . The area has alot of places and shows to see and any family or couple will enjoy a variety of things to do from Fishing to shopping . Its a place that all must visit and see and the place to do it from is the Radisson , Thanks

Reviews.Title: “On Main Street”
Reviews.Author: RainmanMMX
Reviews.Content: Getting there or anywhere from there is awful, but that is Branson during the summer. Within walking distance of several restaurants, stores, miniature golf, and more. Great views from upper floors!

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: carguy0016
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on hotwire.com for a two night stay. I have conisidered Radisson hotels to be better than average. I was very disappointed with this hotel. According to the website, check in is at 3 pm. We showed up at 3:20 after driving from St. Louis and were ready to check in. The woman at the front desk told us to leave and come back at 4 pm. I thought that was rediculous. The lobby is outdated and ugly, not to what I would expect from a Radisson. Finally, we got to our room later and found it small, out dated, and the bathroom was horible. Our ironing board was broken, the walls were dirty, and the ice machine was broken on our floor. The ceilings were very low throughout the hotel and the bottom floor reminded me of a funeral home. We checked out the pool and it did not look appealing at all. Neither did the restaurant and we decided not wasting our time for trying it at all. Upon check out the lady at the front desk didn't even ask how our stay was. I would not recomend this hotel for anyone, even if you think it is a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: laurad05
Reviews.Content: Overall, I found the Radisson to be a very nice hotel. I thought the beds were soo comfy. Our room was very clean and a reasonable size. The location was great as well: very close to the strip but still had access to the back roads, which made it easier to get around. We had a very speedy check in and checkout as well. The staff was very efficient and friendly. On the negative side, I felt that the pool area should have been larger considering how large this hotel was. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Easy In, Easy Out”
Reviews.Author: tpjohnson
Reviews.Content: The hotel was easy to find and easy to enter and exit due to its location between hwy 76 and the "Yellow Route". The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. We did have trouble with noise from our neighbors, so we moved to a quieter section. The hotel staff was very polite and accommodating, and even helped me move our belongings to another room. Internet was free. The pool is half indoor, half outdoor, which would be fun in the colder months. It is not very big, though. We used Priceline to purchase our room, so it was definitely worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: mckenna40
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson in Branson for a leisure trip and school graduation-It could have not been the most fabulous place to stay. Our room was great and accomodated all of us. The hotel was clean and all the employees could not have been nicer-they all went out of their way to make our stay pleasurable. I will plan on staying there in the future-we always plan a trip before school starts, we will definitely stay at teh Radisson.

Reviews.Title: “The only stop you need to make”
Reviews.Author: PerfectCircuit
Reviews.Content: This is a clean motel with sleep number beds. Everyone was friendly from the front desk to housekkeeping. This is in the middle of it all food , shows and shopping with room service available. The price was fare right in there with all the rest. The view from our room was great you could see it all . Indoor outdoor pool with hot tub and sauna is a big bonus. There is a workout room not my thing though. Only bad part to the stay was we had to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money!!”
Reviews.Author: lorraine8171
Reviews.Content: I initially was going to stay at the Hilton Branson Convention Center. I changed it to the Radisson because they offered the Sleep Number Beds and a breakfast certificate up to $30. BAD MISTAKE!! First of all the beds were terrible!!! The hotel looks pretty good on the outside, but the room are horrible. As soon as we walked into the room I was disgusted, the pillows on the bed looked messy and slept on, not neat at all!! There were water stains on the walls and ceilings of our room. The only nice thing about the bathroom was the granite countertop. Our shampoos and soaps did not even get replinished while we stayed there. Hotel does not offer free continental breakfast and the pool is a complete joke! We plan on going back to Branson but this time, I am booking at the Hilton!! P.S. I forgot to mention the "workout room", almost every machine was broke and not working!

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: sonyaa2001
Reviews.Content: The sleep number beds were not comfortable at all. We had to whisper, you could hear everything in the rooms next to you. There is no vents in the restroom, As each of us showered, the windows to our room got foggy. The staff was ok. They only have two double bed room or King according to the front desk and we had children. So my husband and I were bunched up. It was not a good night sleep. The pool was cool for the children and only a 1/4 of it is inside. The clorine was so strong it was burning our eyes and my husband and I were sitting and watching, there was no room in the pool. I would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “no complaints”
Reviews.Author: travelgalAvon
Reviews.Content: stayed here for one night using gold points until our timeshare was ready the next day. as it is a radisson we were expecting plan vanilla type of place for the one night. boy were we surprised! we were given a suite on the 9th floor which included living room, dining area, kitchen, separate bedroom and a jacuzzi tub in the enormous bathroom. the staff were all beyond nice (best of all) no timeshare pitch. the location is ideal- right by the strip and walkable to many theaters. our only regret was that we could not stay longer. definitely request the 9th floor (key access only) we would definitely go back

Reviews.Title: “Small and cheap, but acceptable”
Reviews.Author: SvennnOly
Reviews.Content: We stayed here free two nights with Bass-Pro deal to view the Big Cedar Lodge condo's, and stayed a third night on our nickel. The rooms were quiet, fairly clean, and comfortable, but not big. Access by road is good, with one of the Branson back-roads behind us, and fairly central on the strip. Parking lot is a multi-level, built on an old sledding hill, no doubt. We did not eat at the hotel, but they appear to cater to the elderly and the bus crowd. We enjoyed the old downtown area of Branson landing to hang out and people-watch and have beers at several of the bars. Nice meal was served at Charlie's steakhouse, with homebrews and a nice lady singing country, but hope you don't try to get seated when a bus arrives! Branson was more fun with the little kids, or when fly-fishing and shooting sporting clays and golfing with friends, but I didn't care much for the shows and bus-tour crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Has Seen Better Days”
Reviews.Author: FinallyTime
Reviews.Content: Borderline shabby hotel; definitely needs updating. Sheets and pad didn’t fit the bed, turn over once and there are big lumps under you. Air conditioner was very loud. Room not the cleanest. Would have liked to have a non-slip mat for the bathtub/shower. Public areas kept very warm. However the breakfast buffet was very good, and the staff members were very helpful and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jenslp
Reviews.Content: This was a very clean hotel. We stayed two nights and really enjoyed our stay. They have Sleep Number beds, which are nice, but VERY loud. Pretty annoying when you hear the person in the next room adjusting their bed when they get in late. Overall, we were impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Great Staff, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: plumblevel
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean with very comfortable beds. We used priceline to get our hotel room. We were treated very well by the staff. They were friendly and courteous. Sometimes when we use priceline we are treated as second class quests but not here. The breakfast buffet was decent. The hotel was very quiet and we enjoyed our stay. The hotel is located on the main strip.

Reviews.Title: “I think this hotel was fantastic!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GoSteelersGo
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for 8 nights and I must say that I loved it. I have no idea what all of the bad reviews were about. I though the room was good size, the pool was fun, and the amenities were good. I had no problem with the parking that has given people nightmares. I mean there were a few nights that we had to walk a little further to get to the hotel but what do people expect. It is a major tourist trap. The bed was great!!. I liked this hotel and I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Love the bed!”
Reviews.Author: ADiscGolfer
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a perfect location, easy access to multiple roads leading to different areas of town. The hotel was clean and in great shape. Our best enjoyment was the Sleep Number bed. Now we're going to have to get one!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, very impressive”
Reviews.Author: DiverDown79
Reviews.Content: I think I am one of the rare 1% of visitors to Branson that are here on business. Radisson was a bit difficult to find from the road as its off the highway (good thing). Parking was spread out a bit, and everything was angled (due to the terrain, no "flat" parking spaces anywhere). Check-in was very fast & with a smile, my Gold Elite status was even welcomed with a larger upgraded corner room. Got to my floor and it was quite a long walk to the end, and my room was very nicely decorated with plenty of furnishings. It was nice being able to use the desk and watch TV while working (this is one of my biggest pet peeves about business hotels - desk facing wall). Had a flat screen tv with ample channels, and a king size sleep number bed. Was able to adjust it to my number and had a very cozy sleep. Internet worked fine, shower worked well, was nice being on the corner where I had ample natural light. All room services & amenities were fine - can't complain

Reviews.Title: “Very nice clean hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Chl0e01
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice and I would definately stay here again. The sleep number beds are very nice, a little adjustment but at least you can customize the bed to your own comfort. Flat screen tv in my room. The room and the bathroom were clean. No bad smells. The heating/air conditioning unit had a option for continual fan, which for me worked out great since I sleep with a fan. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. I didn't swim but I went down and looked at it. There is a hot tub and a indoor pool which continues to outdoors. You have to pay for internet usage on their complimentary computers in the lobby. Didn't like that to well, never been somewhere that makes you pay for the internet. I have to visit Branson several times a year and will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Branson, MO Trip”
Reviews.Author: Badluck615
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very clean, not as roomy as I would think. Small coffee maker in room, I roning board, but no iron, had to call down to front desk to get it and it was a good 30-40 minutes later before I got the iron delivered to the room. Now the beds are the Sleep Number beds, but they split them apart to have two beds in the room, which make the beds very small. Bigger than a twin, but smaller than a full size bed. Not very comfortable for two. Any way, when we come back to Branson, we will stay elsewhere, but we will visit the bar here. Fantastic bartender, doing a wonderful job. Her name is Carolyn so if you visit Branson and want a good drink visit the bar, but I wont recommend staying at the Radisson.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: melissa_479
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from August 2nd and checked out on August 5th. What a disappointment! We reserved the Presidential Suite, and we stayed in it for the first night. Room 900. If you ever get this room, request another one immediately! While the room was spacious, there is only one vent in the bedroom. It was August 2nd in the Ozarks, and it was soooo hot! The first night was miserable even though we placed a fan in the main room trying to blow cool air into the bedroom. The next day maintenance came to take a look. Of course, they can't do anything about there being only one vent in that room. The maintenance guys were very nice however. They apparently get complaints about how hot room 900 is all the time. We then were moved into the next size down in suites, the leisure suite. This room was okay, but much smaller and the entire reason we booked the presidential suite was because we wanted space. And on a final note, the furniture and fixtures are very outdated. Don't buy into the whole "we recently remodeled promise" listed on their website. Also, the pool is extremely small! And a bit dirty. The restaurant, however, does serve excellent meals. The staff/concierge is off no help either. Very uninterested in any problem you may have. We definately would not stay there again and will never recommend this particular hotel. There are expectations that one has when booking with the Radisson name, and this hotel does not meet them.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & comfortable, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: travelmomma122
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our stay in Branson. I was very wary of the hotel after reading the reviews, but we did the "timeshare" deal with Bluegreen, so we didn't have a choice of hotel. I work for a respectable hotel, so I am very aware of hospitality, cleanlieness, etc. The only somewhat "rude" person we encountered was the front desk gentleman. He seemed disturbed that so many people were checking in at once. He wasn't really unpleasant and even gave us a king bed when he found out it was only the 2 of us. The housepersons were all very friendly. The room was spotless and looked great. They have the prettiest ice buckets! The bed was a sleep number which I didn't care for, my husband on the other hand loved it. It wasn't uncomfortable, I just like lying down w/o adjusting the bed setting. Our a/c was on and working great upon check-in, but the reviews about the hallways are correct. 2 of the elevators have windows to the outside, which makes them somewhat steamy, but it's a short ride. The hotel has 2 restraunts and bar onthe lower level. The pool is an indoor/outdoor with an indoor hot tub. The hot tub had foamy stuff on the top which suggests that it needs a good cleaning. The water also looked yellowish from the walls of the tub. Kind of grossed me out. The pool is open until midnight with adults only from 12-2, which is a very nice feature. There was a security/maintenence person there to ensure that rule. The location is fantastic, right in the middle of the strip. We walked to dinner and to an ice cream shop with no problem. The hotel is located on the yellow route, which is a timesaver if you are going to SDC or back to Hwy 65. Make sure you get a map to look at the routes. All in all we enjoyed the hotel, but I wouldn't stay there at a regular rate.

Reviews.Title: “very nice suites with a view”
Reviews.Author: ontheopenroad
Reviews.Content: my friends mom is the manager here so we stayed in one of the top rooms where you to have special keys to get to the floor with the suites. it was awesome and i felt so safe. the suite was spacious and the furniture was comfy. not to mention they had a small balcony that overlooked a good portion of the city. it was very neat. i would reccomend anyone to stay here!!!!

Reviews.Title: “HOT Hotel! NO Air Conditioning in Halls or elevators! Units in room POOR Air!”
Reviews.Author: Travelalot54
Reviews.Content: HOT Hotel ! NO Air Conditioning in halls ! Which you will be in a lot cause ice makers are broke on many floors and you will have to go hunt for ice! NO Air Conditioning in Elevators ! Hope no one ever gets stuck in one of those HOT elevators cause they will most likey DIE before they get out ! Window units in rooms freeze over and stop working in middle of night ! HOT MISSERABLE ! They must be to cheap to run Hotel Air Conditioning! If you LOVE HOT stay here! PLUS FORGET about trying to use the hotel luggage cart as the bell hops will NOT let you and insist on getting your luggage for you for TIP $$ They stand at the door $$$ hungry waiting for cars to pull up and check in ! HOT ! Pool yucky and DIRTY ! NO relief there either!

Reviews.Title: “Liked this Hotel a lot”
Reviews.Author: blah114
Reviews.Content: The hotel is easily worth $120 nightly, which is what we paid. We liked the beds.. ours was a king sized bed. You can adjust both "sides" via the sleep #. The hotel was a tad noisy, but if you turn up AC, you'll be fine. The front desk advised where to go, when, and by what means. We liked the hotel, as we slept well at night. It's off the strip, yet right next to an adjoining street. It's right next to everything. I would say this hotel is a bit dated, but it's a very nice place at which to stay. It was clean, staff were nice, and its location is amazing.. really nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Hotel but my Sleep Number is 100”
Reviews.Author: wbcooksey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson for three nights while on a Blue-Green Company “Timeshare Vacation”. The hotel is located just off the strip close to plenty of dining and entertainment. If you bring your own laptop, wireless internet is free, though you must pay for use of the public computers in the lobby. The hotel has a hot tub and a pool, with part of the pool indoors and part of the pool outdoors (separated by an above-water wall). The hot tub is indoors. Parking was no problem at all. Service was courteous and prompt, though they didn’t seem very knowledgeable about restaurants and attractions. I got the impression the front deck check-in staff doubled as the concierge staff. Now for worst part of the place: The wretched Sleep Number beds. I was told that all king sized beds were sleep numbers, while some, if not all of the doubles were regular beds. My wife HATED the Sleep Number beds, and I wasn’t too hot-to-trot on them either. We had to call maintenance once because her side of the bed was loosing air during the night. It WAS fixed promptly, but for sure we’re NEVER buying a sleep number bed for our personal use. Overall, we would stay here again, but we would to skip the sleep numbers. Also, the room we stayed in, didn’t have a hide-a-bed or pullout for the child.

Reviews.Title: “Warning: There are much better OR cheaper (or both!) hotels”
Reviews.Author: hello_frankie
Reviews.Content: Please reconsider staying here if you are planning on it. I found this hotel very uncomfortable. Here are my main areas of complaint: BEDS: I do not know if it was the "Sleep Number" bed they're promoting, but the beds are my very first complaint. They felt like someone jammed a bunch of giant marshmallows under a thin mattress pad, covered it with an old, scratchy fitted sheet. ROOMS: Extremely outdated. We felt very depressed in these rooms with older tvs (we don't even watch tvs; these were just a huge eyesore), low ceilings, poor ventilation and lighting, and outdated, plasticky and/or faux-brass fixtures. BATHROOM: Creepy. Basic plastic and tile. Poor lighting. Stains. A thin and flimsy PLASTIC shower curtain on PLASTIC hooks. The kind of thing you'd find in a roadside, bargain motel. Not a place that went for a discounted $109 on Priceline! LOBBY: Check-in unfriendly and inefficient. PARKING LOT: We are a young, fit couple, and the parking lot was even a pain for us. Just a warning, since I imagine many older folks, people with disabilities, or people who just want to relax on vacation will not like this. The hotel wasn't even *that* full but we had to park quite far and walk up an incline with suitcases and an infant. SUMMARY: I was extremely disappointed in my room considering the money paid. It's one of those places that just doesn't FEEL clean, even if it is. You get the impression it had a quick wipe with a wet paper towel and that's it. I went back to Branson a month later and stayed at the Marriott Residence Inn in a much nicer, newly remodeled, clean room for less money. (See separate review.) In summary, DO NOT think because it costs $X amount it's nicer than a Holiday Inn Express or even the Howard Johnson's. I have not been inside these hotels, but I am guessing it is not. In some cities, you get an idea of how nice or modern a property is by its rack rate. This is NOT the case in Branson an you might be sorely disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Oklatraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson because we were doing the Blue Green resorts tour. That's a whole other review of it's own. So we didn't have a choice as to where we would stay when we booked. As it turned out, it was a good stay. We checked in on Thanksgiving Day about 10:30am. Thankfully our room was ready. Had a good view of the Branson strip and a non smoking room with King bed just as requested. It is basically your typical hotel room although it did have a sleep number bed which was awesome! Pretty good size room with a desk, a chair and ottoman, iron & ironing board, cable TV, etc. No fridge or microwave but did have a small coffee pot I think. Clean. Since it was Thanksgiving, we ate at the buffet they offered for $19pp. It was pretty good and we definitely got stuffed. They also have a pizzeria there but we never did see it open so not sure what hours it's open. They had an outdoor heated pool and believe or not, there were kids swimming both days we were there and it was COLD! But they were having a ball! The location is convenient on the strip. But be sure to take the back roads to get around (yellow to the hotel from the highway), traffic is horrible! Of course the shopping day after Thanksgiving didn't help matters. But it is not very far at all from the Tanger factory outlet mall. That was crazy! And the other outlet mall wasn't far either. We toured the Christmas light display, not sure which one it was (it must NOT have been the one that is rated among the top 10 in the US) but they charged $10 for a car load and that wasn't really worth $10. We went to the movie theater, not the IMAX one but the other one...Branson something. We went Thanksgiving night and it was BUSY! Saw 4 Christmas's and that was funny! I can't say much about the food in Branson. Seems all they offer is buffet's and I was tired of those. We ate breakfast at the peppercorn on the way out, and that wasn't anything to write home about. The breakfast buffet was only $4.99 but the coffee is $1.99 each, so it was still $15 plus tax for the two of us. The best meal we ate was the one at the Radisson. Overall it was a good stay. I would recommend the Radisson for your stay in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson Branson rip off”
Reviews.Author: trainman79
Reviews.Content: 1. First, they don't guarantee the room you request. I checked in at 6 PM. Want a king sized if you're tall? Reservation just guarantees you get a room and not the one you requested. At check in a couple requested a room and had not made a reservation. They were given the last king sized bed, bedroom. I'm next, and sorry, you're reservation just guarantees a room and not the one you request. We got two standard beds. Heckuva way to spend a honeymoon? 2. Sleep number beds. Worthless. You set it for somewhat firm at 75. My wife set hers for 50. By the next morning, it's at zero, because the air goes out of them overnight. This will make you somewhat stiff and achy if you're not used to it. If you way 500 pounds or so, or want an extremely soft bed, this will be the place for you....If you get a room that you request....

Reviews.Title: “Raddisson”
Reviews.Author: In_love_with_NY
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Raddisson this weekend to celebrate our 32nd wedding anniversary. I'd read many of the reviews before arriving at the hotel so I was sure to look my room over. My room was clean and my bed was very comfortable. All of the beds are sleep number beds so you can adjust it to your liking. The bathroom was clean and I like the full length mirror. Bathroom was avg. size. A LOT bigger than the ones in NY. I do wish hotels would somehow do away with the wall AC units and build in individual thermostats. They are just so noisy. I was up a couple of times turning it off and on. The carpet on the stairs leading to the lower level was either very well worn or needing a shampoo. The hotel staff I encountered were all friendly. The parking lot is hard to maneuver being on a hill but many of the hotels in the Branson area are on hills due to the geography of the area. I didn't find the elevators slow at all. They were all working fine while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson needs an facelift.”
Reviews.Author: stubbs1970
Reviews.Content: Held a meeting at the Radisson. Arranged for a block of rooms to attend 3 day meeting - most arrived early or stayed beyond the end of the meeting. The property was very disappointing. Lots of mechanical problems - fire alarms going off repeatedly, inoperative elevators, etc. 4 PM on the day of arrival we could not get checked in because there were no clean rooms available. By the end of our meeting, many of the people in our block of rooms had unresolved problems with the facilities such as inoperative A/C units, slow drains, etc. The real turn-off though was caused by spraying for bugs the weekend before our arrival. On Monday, there were dead bugs all over the hallways, meeting rooms, and even in some of the guest rooms in our block. The banquets staff and food service were excellent, and this is a good location. Needs some capital improvement, though. And the front desk and housekeeping staff need additional training. Taking care of guests is not something they do particularly well. There were quite a few complaints about this location from the meeting attendees. We will not be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson, Branson...Nothing to write home about...”
Reviews.Author: 4haneys
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson, Branson for two nights. The hotel is adequate, but not magnificient. We paid $80 per night, I booked through Priceline, however, I understand the regular rate if you book through the hotel is $140. If I had paid the $140, I would be upset, however, for $80 per night the stay was tolerable. The rooms could use some updating... the pool is VERY small.... the parking is somewhat of a headache.

Reviews.Title: “$150 Hotel - $50 would have been Plenty!”
Reviews.Author: BransonTravelor
Reviews.Content: Hairball in the foyer. Dirty hallways, dirty lobby. Both looked like hadn't been vacuumed in a month. Clean room, nice linens. Cheap furnishings. Wildwood Bistro serves a good breakfast buffet. Friendly staff. No air conditioning in hallways or elevator. One elevator not working. Because this hotel gives free nights stay for attending Big Cedar Lodge's timeshare facilities, the hotels guests were loud and unmannerly. (Not paying guests) A lot of travelor's door keys did not work in their rooms. What's the difference between a $150 and a $50 a night room???.......$100 bucks!

Reviews.Title: “Probably Better than Most Places in Branson”
Reviews.Author: TanyaP
Reviews.Content: This is an actual semi-high rise hotel, which makes it different than most places in Branson. It sits somewhat off the main road, which makes it quiet. The parking lot is extremely hilly. The bellman told us our room had just been redecorated, but it was pretty plain. We liked the nice bedding, but disliked the flourescent lighting and teeny bathroom and threadbare towels. The hotel bar is laughably understocked, so you'd better not order something as exotic as Dewar's Scotch and be prepared to tell the bartender how to fix the drink you want. This hotel does have a nice lobby area and looks much nicer than most of the places we saw from the main roads.

Reviews.Title: “Smokers Beware”
Reviews.Author: fig414
Reviews.Content: They don't tell you until check-in that ALL the rooms are NON-smoking. You can smoke in the sports bar. It was packed with us smokers. Otherwise the place is fine except for the hurting, tiny pool. 8 loungers in total. Pathetic. The rooms and bed were very nice. Fig

Reviews.Title: “excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: trailrider67
Reviews.Content: I don't usually write reviews although I read and use them. But, after reading all the negatives I had to write. We were booked at the Radisson by a time share tour so we didn't have any choice where we stayed. While staying in the hotel, using the super fast free wi-fi, I read the reviews and was very confused. There were a lot of negative reviews and I have to admit--I didn't see any of it. It was within walking distance to several establishments. The lobby was large and comfortable, concierge was helpful, all desk staff was helpful and friendly. Every area we were in was very clean. We didn't eat at the restaraunt so can't rate it. We didn't use the pool but it looked clean. Our room was clean. We could see a water tower lit up like Christmas at night out our window. The bathroom is small but it's a hotel. If you want the door closed, do it before you sit on the toilet! I loved the mirror on the bathroom door--I could see the back of my hair without holding a mirror. There was no hairs on the floor or in the tub! I also love the bright lights in the bathroom-great for putting makeup on. Clean tub and fantastic water pressure with a good shower head. The sleep number bed was fun to play with. I did fine with it but my husband was on too high a setting the first night and slept better the second night after lowering his number. It gave us an opportunity to try one. We stayed on the 5th floor (548) which I believe had been remodeled. It was very crisp and clean. I love the light fixtures! Yes the parking is hilly but can't be the hotels fault--that's geography. We parked in the back several times and got the first places outside the door. There is a hill back there too. My main complaint about the entire place is that outside the lower level back door is a passage way where everyone congregates to smoke. There is little ventilation and it was terribly smokey. I am a part time smoker and it was awful to me. I had to hold my breath to walk through and felt like I could smell the smoke on me after walking through. They should really not let people smoke so close to the door. I'm sure non-smokers will really hate it! Every staff member we encountered was very friendly. I'm sure I'm not the only one who does lots of research before picking a place to stay and I wanted to let people know that this was a very nice hotel and we enjoyed our time here.

Reviews.Title: “not the greatest”
Reviews.Author: JulesMcIntosh
Reviews.Content: We stayed there during Thanksgiving, which in itself was a mistake to go to Branson. Way too busy and couldn't enjoy ourselves. Anyways, the hotel was overall okay. It was clean and well stocked. The beds were extremely uncomfortable, but maybe thats just because we don't like the sleep number beds. The lobby is nice and clean with a lot of information about the area. There is no free breakfast but there is a resteraunt downstairs. It's not very good and EXTREMELY EXPENSIVE! I mean, I think it cost around 30-40 dollars just for the two of us and I had water to drink. The service is HORRIBLE! We waited over 15 minutes just to pay for our meal after we ate and no one came to the cash regiester so we finaly left and had to come back later to pay. I would recomend going somewhere else if you plan to stay there for longer than a couple of nights. But for a quick night or two stay, its okay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!”
Reviews.Author: funluvinbabe01
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a whirlpool suite and it was great! We loved the private balcony! My 11 year old enjoyed having his own TV too! The bathroom was huge. I only wished the bathroom and bedroom doors had locks. Bed was super comfortable and linens were great. Will definately stay there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: laurie1006
Reviews.Content: I too was concerned about staying here because of some negative reviews. My husband and I shared our 30th wedding anniversary here and stayed 4 nights. All personnel at this hotel have been more than helpful - when we called with a problem with our TV they sent someone up right away (within 5 minutes). The bed was very comfortable and the room was always ready and clean for us when we returned from our daily trips around town. I see that some folks say the parking is bad but for us it was great - we parked around back and always had a close spot to park in. One day we had trouble with our laptop not connecting to the wireless internet, after calling the front desk - they sent up a booster so we could connect - this was on New Years Eve! When we return to Branson we will definitely stay here again and would highly recommend this motel to anyone who wants to visit Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Still a favorite!!!”
Reviews.Author: SEKANSASLady
Reviews.Content: Once again, a great stay! Parking still sucks tho! LOL But the hotel is worth it. Awesome beds!!! We love staying here. The bellman was amazing. Very friendly and more than willing to help with anything!! If you are looking for a nice getaway, here is the place to stay. The resturant onsite has wonderful food, and the prices are not too bad either! Has a cozy little bar, super nice bartender. We were set to stay four nights, the morning of our second night we got a phone call that a family member passed away. Beyond devastation. I called down for a bellman, he took care of everything, the hotel even refunded the next two nights, even though I prepaid and they didn't have too. The bellman even helped pack our things, we were so distraught. I cannot express my gratitude to him or this establishment!

Reviews.Title: “WE HAD A GREAT STAY”
Reviews.Author: JMWOOD
Reviews.Content: Our stay was great! This hotel is right in the heart of Branson, perfect location. We booked the room on Hotels.com, check in and out took 2 minutes total, the room was clean and suited our needs. We didn't care for the Sleep Number bed but other than than we had a perfect stay with no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Had to give my two cents worth”
Reviews.Author: mur
Reviews.Content: I was very worried about staying here after reading the latest reviews but I am starting to wonder about the honesty of some of the people. Of course everything will not be perfect or exactly as you do it at home. If that is what people expect then stay at home. Anyway, our stay was very nice, not filthy as stated in some of the other reviews. Staff were very friendly at check in. Lobby is well furnished with plenty of setting on two different levels with several tv's. Room was clean and ready even for an early check in. Bed was sleep number and on a non-smoking floor as requested. Could not hear neighbors either night and know hotel was very crowded as parking lot was very full. Great location for walking on strip. Did not eat at resturant as Branson has so many I love.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: AllAroundTheTown
Reviews.Content: This is the dirtiest hotel that I've ever visited. I would never stay there again--even if they paid me!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay”
Reviews.Author: tcfsse
Reviews.Content: I would not PAY to stay here even though we did for one night. Pool is way to small. Room smelled of vomit. Then we found the vomit when the TUB did not drain and husband took drain apart. Couldn't get a soda chips or ice on our floor. Charged for roll away we never it. Got charged for breakfast we didn't eat. Sleep number beds yes they were nice. Location great but, that is all they have going for them.

Reviews.Title: “There has to be better choices!”
Reviews.Author: Broker_1
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to a 3 day getaway with my daughter and husband for a little family trip. I chose the Radisson because we have been wanting to try the sleep number beds and also because I was wanting to make sure the hotel would be nice as we haven't traveled with our daughter for about 2 years since she is busy with college and work. The check in was fine, concierge arranged our tickets and was a big help. We were given a room on the 7th floor, non smoking. The room was small, the bathroom was very small. The sink was worn and had many cracks. There was a hole in the wall of the shower where the shower head is attached. We found stray hairs in the bathroom but the rest of the room was clean. One drawer was stuck on the dresser. My daughter's bed had problems with the sleep number control. We had 2 breakfast buffets included with our stay and we ate at the buffet twice. The buffet is $10 which is very high when there are breakfast buffet specials thru out Branson for around $5. We ate there because we had the coupons but wouldn't have went back again if we would of had to pay $30. Service was good in the restaurant as well as the bar. The swimming pool area was not very nice. Very untidy and full of unsupervised children all hours of the day and night. There is a sign that children are allowed until midnight, the latest we stayed at the pool area was 11 and the children were out in full force. I have nothing against children but I do think there should be some adult supervision. I had to stop one child from diving in the whirlpool head first! I would not stay at this property again. I think it is in serious need of updating and there are better choices. I really expected more from a hotel with a Radisson name and also considering that it was highly rated it was a huge disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Radisson”
Reviews.Author: sarcar925
Reviews.Content: We also were quite worried about staying at this hotel after reading some of the previous reviews. We had an excellent experience. We requested a roll-away bed & it was brought to our room before we could even get all of our luggage into our room. After running out of towels late one evening (our fault, not the hotels), the front desk called us two times to make certain that housekeeping had brought the extra towels to our room. Other people commented on the small bathroom size & the bad parking. We did not find the bathroom any smaller than other hotels. The parking was also adequate. The back lot is quite steep, however, the hotel is in very hilly country!

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't as good as expected”
Reviews.Author: planetduke
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Raddisson for 2 nights. The beds weren't what we expected and after reading the ratings this hotel has I wouldn't have expected to have so many problems. Some of the employees were rude I thought that maybe they were just having a bad day but they were rude both nights we were there. The pool looks bigger in the pictures than it really is the kids didn't really like it and the exercise room was empty nothing in there but space. The restaurant was extremely over priced and the service there was awful I had to refill my own coffee twice. I personnally would not stay there again if given a choice.

HotelInfo.Name: Radisson Hotel Branson
HotelInfo.Address: 120 South Wildwood Drive, Branson, MO 65616
